alert.note: Alert for Boone; McHenry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 7:34PM CDT until April 30 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Illinois and northeast Illinois, including the following counties, in north central Illinois, Boone. In northeast Illinois, McHenry. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 PM CDT, radar indicated that between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding of ditches and low-lying areas will gradually subside this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Belvidere, Harvard, Poplar Grove, Candlewick Lake, Cherry Valley, Capron, Timberlane, Garden Prairie and Chemung. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
